title: Tsr Inline Assignment
narrative:
In this specification we cover the behaviour of tensors with respect to the assignment operation
    as well as the assignment of individual tensor items.

features.id: We can use the "mut" API to assign the contents of one tensor into another one.

blocks.text: We assign the contents of "b" into "a" using the "mut" API:
The contents of "a" should be the same as the contents of "b":

features.id: Assignment can be easily achieved through subscription operators.

blocks.text: An tensor of bytes with shape (2, 3).
We assign the tensor a to the tensor n.
The Tsr n has the expected values.

features.id: We can assign one slice into another one.

extraInfo:
Note that using the 'assign' operation on slices should be handled with care,
            since the operation has side effects on the underlying data array
            which is shared by both the slice and its parent.
            Use the 'copy' operation on slices if you want to avoid this.

blocks.text: We create to very simple slices of 3 items in the above vectors.
The slices will have the expected state.
We now assign the first slice into the second one.
Both slices will have the same numbers "1, 2, 3" in them.
The 2 original vectors will also both have the same numbers "1, 2, 3" in them.
